name: Video
description: HTML5 video component with multiple source and configuration options for displaying video content with fallback support and accessibility features.

has_controls.description: Whether the video should have controls.

fallback_text.default: Your browser doesn't support HTML5 video.
fallback_text.description: Message for browsers not supporting HTML5 video.

examples.name: Basic Video with Controls
examples.description: HTML5 video with multiple sources and controls enabled

examples.name: Autoplay Video without Controls
examples.description: Video that plays automatically without user controls

when_to_use: Display video content directly in the page
Create background videos for hero sections
Display video testimonials or case studies
When you need full control over video styling and behavior
when_not_to_use: For streaming video content - use video-player component instead
When you need advanced video player features (playlists, quality selection)
For videos hosted on external platforms (YouTube, Vimeo) - use iframe instead
When bandwidth or performance is a major concern
best_practices: Always provide multiple source formats for browser compatibility
Include meaningful poster images for better user experience
Use appropriate video compression to balance quality and file size
Provide fallback text for accessibility and unsupported browsers
Consider autoplay policies and user preferences (mute autoplay videos)
Use descriptive titles for screen readers
Test video performance across different devices and connections

accessibility.notes: Videos should include captions, transcripts, and audio descriptions when applicable. The title attribute helps screen readers identify video content.

known_issues: Autoplay behavior varies across browsers and user settings
Large video files can impact page loading performance
Some mobile browsers may not support all video formats or features
variations: Basic video: Standard HTML5 video with controls
Background video: Autoplay video without controls for decorative purposes
Responsive video: Video that adapts to container size
Multi-format video: Video with multiple source formats for compatibility
